name: Redis Writer (single-key)
description: Writes key-value pair to a Redis store. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
import redis
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, BoolInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data

class RedisWriterComponent(Component):
    name = "RdnzRedisWriterSingle"
    icon = "layers-3"
    display_name = "Redis Writer (single-key)"
    description = "Writes key-value pair to a Redis store."

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="key",
            display_name="Key",
            info="The key to store in Redis.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="value",
            display_name="Value",
            info="The value to store in Redis.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="redis_url",
            display_name="Redis URL",
            info="The URL for the Redis connection.",
            value="redis://localhost:6379",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="override",
            display_name="Override Existing",
            info="Whether to override the key if it already exists.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Redis Response", name="redis_response", method="write_to_redis"),
    ]

    def write_to_redis(self) -> Data:
        key = self.key
        value = self.value
        redis_url = self.redis_url
        override = self.override

        try:
            # Connect to Redis
            r = redis.from_url(redis_url)

            # Check if the key exists and if we should override
            if not override and r.exists(key):
                result = "Key already exists. Set 'Override Existing' to True to overwrite."
            else:
                # Write to Redis
                result = r.set(key, value, nx=not override)
                if result:
                    result = "OK"  # Mimic Redis SET response
                else:
                    result = "Failed to set value"

            self.status = f"Write operation completed: {result}"
            return Data(data={"result": result})
        except redis.RedisError as e:
            self.status = f"Redis error: {str(e)}"
            raise
code.name: code

key.name: key
key.info: The key to store in Redis.

override.name: override
override.info: Whether to override the key if it already exists.

redis_url.name: redis_url
redis_url.info: The URL for the Redis connection.

import redis
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, BoolInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data

class RedisWriterComponent(Component):
    name = "RdnzRedisWriterSingle"
    icon = "layers-3"
    display_name = "Redis Writer (single-key)"
    description = "Writes key-value pair to a Redis store."

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="key",
            display_name="Key",
            info="The key to store in Redis.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="value",
            display_name="Value",
            info="The value to store in Redis.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="redis_url",
            display_name="Redis URL",
            info="The URL for the Redis connection.",
            value="redis://localhost:6379",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="override",
            display_name="Override Existing",
            info="Whether to override the key if it already exists.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Redis Response", name="redis_response", method="write_to_redis"),
    ]

    def write_to_redis(self) -> Data:
        key = self.key
        value = self.value
        redis_url = self.redis_url
        override = self.override

        try:
            # Connect to Redis
            r = redis.from_url(redis_url)

            # Check if the key exists and if we should override
            if not override and r.exists(key):
                result = "Key already exists. Set 'Override Existing' to True to overwrite."
            else:
                # Write to Redis
                result = r.set(key, value, nx=not override)
                if result:
                    result = "OK"  # Mimic Redis SET response
                else:
                    result = "Failed to set value"

            self.status = f"Write operation completed: {result}"
            return Data(data={"result": result})
        except redis.RedisError as e:
            self.status = f"Redis error: {str(e)}"
            raise
